title.rendered: SEO and Authority: How to Get on the First Page of Google

content.rendered:
Building a successful SEO strategy isn’t something that happens overnight.

You need to develop a strong understanding of SEO and other digital marketing practices if you’re going to get your website on the first page of Google. Between blogging, social media, and SEO, it can be a full-time job just to maintain a website, let alone bring in enough traffic to get to the top of the SERPs (Search Engine Result Pages).

In this post, we’re going to talk about SEO and authority so that you can figure out how to get on the first page of Google. You’ll quickly see that SEO and blogging are more important to the online success of your business than you may have thought. 

How to Get On the First Page of Google?

Getting on the first page of Google is what all businesses strive for. It’s not easy to do, however, so follow these tips as you get started.

Long-Tail Keywords

The Google search algorithm is dominated by long-tail keywords these days. In the past, the right keywords were short phrases that you could slide into your blogs to get more hits. 

Long-tail keywords have come along, due in part to voice search. Although they have a lower search volume, the conversion rate is much higher. Utilize these, capitalize on user search intent to drive traffic to your site, make more conversions, and you could possibly end up on the first page of Google.

Blog Away

Blogging is as important as it’s ever been. The problem with prioritizing long-tail keywords is that they’re much harder to integrate into your posts. Stuffing them in will look unnatural and put off your readers.

To combat this, you need to blog more frequently to make use of more long-tail keywords, establish your authority in the field, and beat out your competitors to the top of Google. Writing new posts every 1-2 days is a must if you’re going to reach these heights.

Your Site

Having a functional website has always been important, but it’s more complicated now than it’s ever been. We have more devices, which gives you more opportunity for promotion, but also more responsibility when it comes to web design and maintenance.

For instance, having a really nice mobile site is as important as your desktop site. More people are performing searches on their phones, so if you’re going to rank at the top of the Google SERPs, you’d better have a site that works well on phones and tablets.

Not only should it look nice and work well, but it’s also got to be fast. You can find all sorts of daunting statistics that shed some light on customer behavior. You’ve only got a few seconds to grab people’s attention, so you’d better seize it with a quick site.

Learn SEO and Watch Your Business Flourish

Now that you have some tips to get to the first page of Google, you can start working on your SEO strategy. Developing authority with your audience isn’t easy, but with our help, you can take your SEO to a new level.
